Since I have no information about your sales record, I must rely on the general probability of the product being high or low quality. Given the product has a 50% chance of being high quality and a 50% chance of being low quality, and it costs $1000000 but is only worth $1250000 if high quality and $0 if low quality, the expected value ($1250000 * 0.5 + $0 * 0.5 = $625000) is less than the cost. Therefore, it is not a good investment.
